meanings.definition: A type of thick, stiff paperboard used for bookbinding and other purposes.
meanings.sent1: The book cover was made of sturdy millboard.
meanings.sent2: She used millboard to create a model of the Eiffel Tower.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the millboard was a great scratching post.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as a piece of millboard.
meanings.sent5: The millboard's thickness made it perfect for crafting sturdy boxes.

meanings.definition: To cover or line with millboard.
meanings.sent1: He decided to millboard the walls for extra insulation.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully millboarded the edges of the book cover.
meanings.sent3: She playfully suggested they millboard the entire room for fun.
meanings.sent4: The idea to millboard the ceiling sparked a creative solution.
meanings.sent5: Millboarding the floor made it more durable for heavy foot traffic.
